intro: Geranium ensatum, commonly known as the purple geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that range in color from pink to deep purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and serrated, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are borne in dense clusters at the ends of the stems, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Geranium ensatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
